answers.answer: I did with my first child. My ankles and even my feet swelled. It hurt to wear shoes alot of the time. And I worked a full time factory job at the time. I suffered thru it and stayed on my feet only as much as I had to and was actually able to make accomidations to my job so I could sit down when I had to. Good luck! Stay cool and drink plenty of fluids.
Thanks will do!! I just didnt expect it to be this bad this early!!
Just Be Extra Careful Because if You Develop Pre Eclampsia that's Really Bad For You And Baby. Maybe Let Your Dr Know Just To Be On The Safe Side
I did but I noticed it came and went. Now I am 34 weeks its happening more often.

Yeah the preeclampsia is what I'm worried about. Of course it started happening the day after my last appt and I dknt go for another 3 weeks. But ive been monitoring my blood pressure at home and work and its stable and in a good range. Its actually gone this morning...thank god!! Thanks for your input ladies :)

question: I am 21 weeks and already getting realy swollen ankles! I work full time as a nurse so I'm on my feet a lot. My blood pressure is stable and in a good range. Anyone else suffering from this??
title: Swollen Ankles!!
